citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)
citeinfo.title: EPIC: Desktop Scientific Visualization and Analysis of Ocean Data

descript.abstract: The goal of this project is to provide climate researchers with sophisticated routines and procedures for management, visualization and analysis of ocean hydrographic data sets, in order to obtain a basic description of the physical properties and circulation of the ocean. Understanding climate change depends on detailed scientific knowledge of the ocean and it's interaction with the atmosphere. Much has been learned about atmospheric circulation patterns. However, the ability to make climate predictions months in advance and to project climate change over periods of years to decades requires an understanding of the role of ocean circulation and the interaction of the ocean with the atmosphere. The goal of this project is to enable such research by providing the climate researcher with sophisticated data management, visualization and analysis procedures for oceanic hydrographic data, in support of the cross cutting science efforts required for assessment and prediction of annual and decadal climate variations and changes.
descript.purpose: To report on the EPIC: DESKTOP SCIENTIFIC VISUALIZATION AND ANALYSIS OF OCEAN DATA.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
